review_body: I bought this exact same very powerful device about 10 years ago and it lasted about 3 years. The motor is still good but the cloth wore out and because a pillow case works OK, but is not perfect, I decided to buy another one. It is a miracle for my lower back and does not bog down the motor when I lay on it with all my weight. It's a very powerful motor and I highly recommend this product. DO NOT waste your money on cheap knock-offs. There are none that compare to the overall high quality of this high-performance massager.

I purchased this product in the fall of 2022 and have had it for 2 and 1/2 years now. I love it! It is so effective and so easy to use. I have a dedicated chair in my room that it stays in, but I can easily take it downstairs to the couch and have it be just as effective. I struggle with a lot of muscle tension, and the option for heat or no heat is so great. It would be nice if it could have some additional settings, but I don't really need it. Not when it's such a dependable worker. I've used it for an hour straight and it still works even when I'm leaning on it. I'm only about 150. But I have other massagers that won't even make it the full 15 or 20 minutes they say that they're supposed to do if I relax against it. This thing is strong and gets the job done! And the heat really lets your muscles relax a little more so the kneading can do its job. I love this thing so much that I've bought a few more to give as gifts to friends. And I like that since it is small it is easy to move from my lower back to my middle back to shoulders. Without having a big heavy chair that's dedicated. Love this little guy!

This massager works amazingly.. it will kneed deep into your back with non-painful upward and downward compressing pressure. (Like how a masseuse would use their thumbs to circle toward each other) It has heated or non-headed mode, and when the cover wore out (which is inevitable because of the friction created by the kneeding), Zyllion promptly honored the year warranty and mailed me a new cover USPS express. For $40, it's hard not to give this massager 5 stars, however, there are a couple notable flaws which keep it from being an unbelievable deal.
The Cons:
**As mentioned previously, the friction from the kneeding makes it inevitable that the stitching joining materials will be torn. It did, however, take 3-4 months of heavy use (and I'm a 280# guy) before the stitching gave way, so I feel I got my value out of the product. The fact that they replaced the cover so that I will get even more life out of the product is great! Incidentally, I tried sewing a cotton patch to repair the cover myself, however, any material other than a slick nylon/polyester catches on the wheels, and gets twisted into oblivion.
**When not run in heating mode, the unit can operate fairly indefinitely, though it will gradually heat up from use.
**When run in heating mode, the unit can run for 3-4 consecutive cycles (a cycle seems to take a couple minutes) before overheating and needing to be left alone for a bit.
**the quick disconnect is more of an inevitable disconnect. It makes the unit close to unusable, except that you can wrap it around the elastic band so it doesn't pull free. Placing the pillow against a chair for using it will often work the quick disconnect free.

The Pros:
** Works amazing! Use it for your lower or upper back, your neck, your thighs or your calves.. the kneeding effect is useful anywhere you can create opposing pressure against the pillow. Works well enough that I hear the occassional pop as my joints loosen up, and my back usually cracks after use. I'd estimate the pillow can handle about 10 lbs of pressure before the motor starts to object. This means if put it on the ground and lay with your back on it, you'll probably slow down, and shorten the life of, the motor.. but if you prop yourself with pillows or foam roller to alleviate the pressure...
** Has heated or non-heated mode. The heat really helps to work out the kinks, particularly if it's cold out.
** Really compact. Smaller than most pillows, though not at all squishy.
** Can run virtually non-stop when not running in heat mode.
** Can run in both car and home, and, I feel, makes driving more comfortable as it provides lower back support helping me sit upright.

She says it’s easier to use while on the sofa watching tv or doing work at home.

This hands-on technique aims to alleviate pain, stiffness, and dysfunction caused by tight or restricted fascia. It can be used to treat a wide range of conditions, including back and neck pain, fibromyalgia, and sports injuries, with benefits such as increased range of motion and reduced pain.  I tried to find that therapy locally. Cost was 60-80 dollars for 30 minutes. I bought this item and I have used it three times already. It is amazing with it's soothing results. The heat is very comfortable. It has already paid for itself.

I love this product and have suggested it to my family and friends with back pain and they have had the same wonderful experience. It works incredibly well and a natural remedy without pain meds or expensive PT. On top of that, the best customer service I have ever experienced.
I highly recommend this company and products.

I'm right in the middle for this little massager. I researched a bunch and this one seemed to have the best reviews, but I'm just a little disappointed for my needs and might get something else.

PROS
-Holds up well to pressure! I really try to dig into certain places and so far, after about 5 uses, it's still working, doesn't stop, and keeps massaging. I like that a lot. It goes a bit slower sometimes but I trust it will keep going.
-Heat is really nice and soothing and not too hot. Be warned, however, I was pressing hard on my bare skin and got a bit chafed on the heat setting because I was digging into the skin. It wouldn't do that normally, though, it was the way I was using it. Overall the heat is mild and a perfect temp.
-Light and has a long cord, fairly easy to move around.
-Has given me some occasional relief when I've been able to get the right position, for a good night sleep.
-I have had some luck around the lower/mid-neck, even though it's not designed for that. I just move it so one side gets the area I want, which feels good. But overall this is a bit too wide to give a nice "squeeze" to the neck. I'm small, 5'4" and 125 so if you are bigger with a bigger neck this would maybe be great!

CONS
-The directional-switch of the motors is automatic. It's nice sometimes, but I think I'd prefer to be able to control when the rotation switches direction. Often I will be in a sweet spot and it will change and then I'll have to adjust a bit. Nothing terrible but if you are looking for something to really unwind a knot and sustain in one area, I'd go with a model that you can dictate when it changes direction.
-Ball pressure: I find I have a really hard time getting it in a position that doesn't dig TOO hard, or not hard enough. So it's a bit cumbersome and time consuming. For me it's not enough to just lean lightly against a chair and have it pushing on my back. It pokes in weird areas. I find it hard to relax into it unless I find the right spot. When I do, it's nice! But it's like 75% of the time I'm messing with it to get the pressure right. This to me is more about this kind of massager, rather than this specific model. Live and learn!
-I find the simple way it works is sometimes nice and effective, but overall feels a bit monotonous. Someone mentioned in a review that it's not like a nail salon massage chair and I unfortunately find that it's quite similar to those. Just kinda pushes on you and unless you get the right spot. Again, when I have found good spots it's very nice! So far no lasting relief - I got this for painful shoulder and neck issues and I haven't noticed drastic differences, but nothing worse. I also thought it would help my lower back which gets sore or my hips, and it's not had any major results but we shall see.

So I don't find it as AMAZING like some little human robot hands as i was secretly dreaming of, but it's certainly nice to have around the house. It's just an "additional massager" like if I want a "general rub down" somewhere without expecting miracles, and if I can get the hang of where to position it on my wall/chair/couch/body.... but I think I'll have to buy something more detailed with more features for speed or pressure for my main, more painful muscle issues.

But if you are looking for a simple, 2-way rotational massager to just plug away on one spot for 20 minutes and you don't need as much nuance as me, this is well made! Comes with a nice little slipcover for use with heat.

"I need to replace the cover please help"

Zyllion Customer Service immediately responded the very next business day, Monday August 7, 2017—

"Dear Carlo:
"Thank you for your comment!
"We will gladly ship to you a brand new replacement cover at no additional cost."

I almost fell off my chair a second time. Except for a few exceptional companies like American Express, and now I've added Amazon to that list (I've been a client now for 19 years!!!), it is mostly just talk.

ZYLLION IS NOT JUST TALK. THEY DELIVER. With an exceptional product. And I can now add, EXCEPTIONAL SERVICE!!! Thank you, thank you, thank you. I'll be singing your praises near and far from now on!!!

This massager works amazingly.. it will kneed deep into your back with non-painful upward and downward compressing pressure. (Like how a masseuse would use their thumbs to circle toward each other) It has heated or non-headed mode, and when the cover wore out (which is inevitable because of the friction created by the kneeding), Zyllion promptly honored the year warranty and mailed me a new cover USPS express. For $40, it's hard not to give this massager 5 stars, however, there are a couple notable flaws which keep it from being an unbelievable deal.
The Cons:
**As mentioned previously, the friction from the kneeding makes it inevitable that the stitching joining materials will be torn. It did, however, take 3-4 months of heavy use (and I'm a 280# guy) before the stitching gave way, so I feel I got my value out of the product. The fact that they replaced the cover so that I will get even more life out of the product is great! Incidentally, I tried sewing a cotton patch to repair the cover myself, however, any material other than a slick nylon/polyester catches on the wheels, and gets twisted into oblivion.
**When not run in heating mode, the unit can operate fairly indefinitely, though it will gradually heat up from use.
**When run in heating mode, the unit can run for 3-4 consecutive cycles (a cycle seems to take a couple minutes) before overheating and needing to be left alone for a bit.
**the quick disconnect is more of an inevitable disconnect. It makes the unit close to unusable, except that you can wrap it around the elastic band so it doesn't pull free. Placing the pillow against a chair for using it will often work the quick disconnect free.

The Pros:
** Works amazing! Use it for your lower or upper back, your neck, your thighs or your calves.. the kneeding effect is useful anywhere you can create opposing pressure against the pillow. Works well enough that I hear the occassional pop as my joints loosen up, and my back usually cracks after use. I'd estimate the pillow can handle about 10 lbs of pressure before the motor starts to object. This means if put it on the ground and lay with your back on it, you'll probably slow down, and shorten the life of, the motor.. but if you prop yourself with pillows or foam roller to alleviate the pressure...
** Has heated or non-heated mode. The heat really helps to work out the kinks, particularly if it's cold out.
** Really compact. Smaller than most pillows, though not at all squishy.
** Can run virtually non-stop when not running in heat mode.
** Can run in both car and home, and, I feel, makes driving more comfortable as it provides lower back support helping me sit upright.

I highly recommend this company and products.

I'm right in the middle for this little massager. I researched a bunch and this one seemed to have the best reviews, but I'm just a little disappointed for my needs and might get something else.

PROS
-Holds up well to pressure! I really try to dig into certain places and so far, after about 5 uses, it's still working, doesn't stop, and keeps massaging. I like that a lot. It goes a bit slower sometimes but I trust it will keep going.
-Heat is really nice and soothing and not too hot. Be warned, however, I was pressing hard on my bare skin and got a bit chafed on the heat setting because I was digging into the skin. It wouldn't do that normally, though, it was the way I was using it. Overall the heat is mild and a perfect temp.
-Light and has a long cord, fairly easy to move around.
-Has given me some occasional relief when I've been able to get the right position, for a good night sleep.
-I have had some luck around the lower/mid-neck, even though it's not designed for that. I just move it so one side gets the area I want, which feels good. But overall this is a bit too wide to give a nice "squeeze" to the neck. I'm small, 5'4" and 125 so if you are bigger with a bigger neck this would maybe be great!

CONS
-The directional-switch of the motors is automatic. It's nice sometimes, but I think I'd prefer to be able to control when the rotation switches direction. Often I will be in a sweet spot and it will change and then I'll have to adjust a bit. Nothing terrible but if you are looking for something to really unwind a knot and sustain in one area, I'd go with a model that you can dictate when it changes direction.
-Ball pressure: I find I have a really hard time getting it in a position that doesn't dig TOO hard, or not hard enough. So it's a bit cumbersome and time consuming. For me it's not enough to just lean lightly against a chair and have it pushing on my back. It pokes in weird areas. I find it hard to relax into it unless I find the right spot. When I do, it's nice! But it's like 75% of the time I'm messing with it to get the pressure right. This to me is more about this kind of massager, rather than this specific model. Live and learn!
-I find the simple way it works is sometimes nice and effective, but overall feels a bit monotonous. Someone mentioned in a review that it's not like a nail salon massage chair and I unfortunately find that it's quite similar to those. Just kinda pushes on you and unless you get the right spot. Again, when I have found good spots it's very nice! So far no lasting relief - I got this for painful shoulder and neck issues and I haven't noticed drastic differences, but nothing worse. I also thought it would help my lower back which gets sore or my hips, and it's not had any major results but we shall see.

So I don't find it as AMAZING like some little human robot hands as i was secretly dreaming of, but it's certainly nice to have around the house. It's just an "additional massager" like if I want a "general rub down" somewhere without expecting miracles, and if I can get the hang of where to position it on my wall/chair/couch/body.... but I think I'll have to buy something more detailed with more features for speed or pressure for my main, more painful muscle issues.

But if you are looking for a simple, 2-way rotational massager to just plug away on one spot for 20 minutes and you don't need as much nuance as me, this is well made! Comes with a nice little slipcover for use with heat.
